title: Presidio of San Francisco: Directions & Transportation
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation             Directions & Transportation        Coming by Plane  San Francisco, Oakland and San Jose International Airports service the San Francisco Bay area. Coming by Car  The Presidio can be reached from the north by crossing the Golden Gate Bridge (Highways 1 and 101); from the east by way of Lombard Street (Highway 101); and from the south via Highway 1. Note: Detours and delays are possible due to construction of the Presidio Parkway at the Golden Gate Bridge approach. Check out www.presidioparkway.org for the latest updates. Specific Driving Directions Click here for more information on how to drive to the Presidio of San Francisco. Coming by Public Transportation  San Francisco Municipal Railway (MUNI) buses serve the Presidio via the 28, 29 and 43 lines. Bus service from the North Bay to the Golden Gate Bridge toll plaza is available through Golden Gate Transit. The PresidiGo shuttle bus also provides free service to and from downtown San Francisco. Click here to learn more about public transportation. Transit & Trails Find easy information on accessing park trails by walking, biking, car, and/or bus.  Once You Are Here Once you arrive at the Presidio, the PresidiGo shuttles can take you around the park for free. You can also download maps of the park if you would like to drive yourself or to bike or hike its extensive trail system.
